author: Special Correspondent
text:
The search panel that will select three names for the post of Vice-Chancellor of the University of Madras has been constituted. The convener of the committee is P.N. Veda Narayanan, retired commissioner of Vigilance and Development.

Mr. Veda Narayanan is the Governor’s nominee while the other two members are R. Balasubramanian, director, Faculty of Science and Humanities, SRM University, and R. Surendra Prasad, former member of the University Syndicate. Mr. Veda Narayanan was the convener of the search panel of the Tamil Nadu Agricultural University which re-selected K. Ramasamy as Vice-Chancellor.

Mr. Balasubramanian, former professor at Madras University, is the Syndicate nominee while Mr. Prasad was elected by the Senate. He is also a registered full-time Ph D student at the University’s Department of Management Studies.

His selection was opposed by the Madras University Teachers Association which had approached the court. The Madras High Court dismissed the case citing a Supreme Court ruling. MUTA, it is learnt, has appealed to the court against this decision.
title: V-C search panel constituted
